disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Wednesday 18 May to end of Wednesday 18 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Further warm weather for Wednesday as south-east England continues to be affected by a southerly air feed arriving from the Bay of Biscay. Cloud cover and showers will arrive late in the evening.<br/>Little imported pollution is expected on the southerly air path and this, combined with increasing cloud cover, will limit the potential for ground-level ozone formation. Although winds will be quite light, there'll be enough air movement to disperse local emissions.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Thursday 19 May to end of Thursday 19 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Heavy rain will clear on Thursday morning leaving most of the day warm and sunny.<br/><br/>Little imported pollution is expected on the southerly air path and this, combined with increasing cloud cover, will limit the potential for ground-level ozone formation. Although winds will be quite light, there'll be enough air movement to disperse local emissions.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
